Description: Egyptian(?) terracotta mould-made female figure. Eroded head fragment only.Traces of red paint on hair. Orange-brown fabric with black core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, rounded quartz, black and white inclusions up to 1mm in size.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar to hollow figure of Aphrodite from Naukratis in the British Museum (GR 1886,0401.1404, Bailey 2008, 101; Petrie et al. 1886, 41, pl. 15, 2; Walters 1903: C 618; Fischer 1994, no. 152). There are 2nd and 1st century BC parallels across the Hellenistic world, with Smyrna and Myrina Aphrodite figures and Arsinoe II and III portraits copying Aphrodite (Burn and Higgins 2001, 133, pl. 58; Bailey 2008, no.2318). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen,Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.413) (Phase 1)
